alert.note: Alert for Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:10PM CST until January 14 at 12:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana...Mississippi... Pearl River Near Bogalusa affecting Pearl River and Washington Counties. For the Lower Pearl River...including Bogalusa...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River near Bogalusa. * WHEN...From late Thursday night to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Woodlands and crop acreage along the river will be flooded. The Bogue Chitto Wildlife Management area will be inundated with water in recreational camps and over access roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning to a crest of 18.5 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 02/07/1959. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 215 PM CST.
